metadata.title: CVE-2019-14317 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
wolfSSL and wolfCrypt 4.1.0 and earlier (formerly known as CyaSSL) generate biased DSA nonces. This allows a remote attacker to compute the long term private key from several hundred DSA signatures via a lattice attack. The issue occurs because dsa.c fixes two bits of the generated nonces.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-14317` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl24 - 4.2.0+dfsg-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0+dfsg-3').
